key.description: If true, saves the last window state on exit and restores it upon new invocation

key.name: window-style
key.summary: Style to use for displaying the tilix window
key.description: The style to use for displaying the tilix window, enables disabling Client-Side_Decorations.

key.name: app-title
key.summary: The application title that is used
key.description: The title to use for the application, can be composed of literal strings and supported tokens.

key.name: auto-hide-mouse
key.summary: Whether to automatically hide the mouse pointer when typing
key.description: If true, the mouse pointer is hidden when the user starts typing and shown again when interaction with the mouse occurs.

key.name: prompt-on-new-session
key.summary: Whether to prompt for session settings or use defaults
key.description: If true, when creating a new session a prompt will appear to pick the session name and profile used.

key.name: prompt-on-close
key.summary: Whether to prompt on close when multiple sessions are active
key.description: If true, a prompt is shown confirming closing the window when multiple sessions are active.

key.name: prompt-on-close-process
key.summary: Whether to prompt on close when processes are still running
key.description: If true, a prompt is shown confirming closing the window when processes are running.

key.name: prompt-on-delete-profile
key.summary: Whether to prompt on profile deletion
key.description: If true, a prompt is shown confirming the deletion of a profile.

key.name: session-name
key.summary: The default name to use for a session
key.description: The default name of the session, terminal variables can be used in which case the active terminal resolves the variables.

key.name: enable-transparency
key.summary: Whether transparency is enabled
key.description: If true, transparency is enabled in terminals.

key.name: terminal-title-style
key.summary: The style to use for terminal titles
key.description: Which style to use for terminal titles, normal, small or none.

key.name: terminal-title-show-when-single
key.summary: Show the terminal title even if its the only terminal
key.description: When enabled, the terminal title bar will remain visible when only a single terminal exists in the session

key.name: enable-wide-handle
key.summary: Whether splitters use a narrow (default) or wide handle
key.description: If true, splitters between terminals use a wide handle. Only supported in GTK 2.16 and later.

key.name: close-with-last-session
key.summary: Whether the window should close when the last session is closed
key.description: If false, when the last session is closed, a new session is opened.

key.name: use-overlay-scrollbar
key.summary: If true, uses an overlay scrollbar instead of a separate widget
key.description: If true, uses an overlay scrollbar instead of a separate widget if GTK is 3.22 or greater.

key.name: theme-variant
key.summary: Which theme variant to use

key.name: new-instance-mode
key.summary: Default behavior when opening a second instance of Tilix

key.name: notify-on-process-complete
key.summary: Whether to notify when a process is completed
key.description: If true, notifications will be sent when non-visible processes complete in terminals.

key.name: menu-accelerator-enabled
key.summary: Whether the standard GTK shortcut for menubar access is enabled
key.description: Normally you can access the menubar with F10. This can also be customized via gtkrc (gtk-menu-bar-accel = "whatever"). This option allows the standard menubar accelerator to be disabled.

key.name: middle-click-close
key.summary: Whether clicking the middle mouse button closes the terminal
key.description: When true, clicking the middle mouse button on the terminal title bar will close it.

key.name: control-scroll-zoom
key.summary: Whether the control key and the mouse wheel zooms the terminal
key.description: When true, using the control key with the mouse scroll wheel will zoom the terminal in and out.

key.name: accelerators-enabled
key.summary: Whether accelerators for shortcuts are enabled
key.description: When this is false, accelerators are disabled and any accelerators set will be ignored.

key.name: unsafe-paste-alert
key.summary: Alert the user about unsafe paste
key.description: Warn the user when pasting a command into the terminal that might be considered unsafe.

key.name: paste-strip-first-char
key.summary: Strip the first character from a paste when comment or variable declaration
key.description: If true, if the first character is a comment (#) or a variable declaration($) it will be stripped on paste.

key.name: paste-strip-trailing-whitespace
key.summary: Strip trailing whitespace on paste.
key.description: If true, trailing whitespace will be stripped when pasting.

key.name: paste-advanced-default
key.summary: Use the advanced paste as the default paste
key.description: If true, the advanced paste dialog is always used when paste is activated.

key.name: copy-on-select
key.summary: Automatically copy selected text to clipboard
key.description: If true, when text is selected in the terminal it is automatically copied to the clipboard.

key.name: search-default-match-case
key.summary: Whether to match case
key.description: If true, searches will be case sensitive.

key.name: search-default-match-entire-word
key.summary: Whether to match the entire word
key.description: If true, search must be the entire word in order to be considered a match.

key.name: search-default-match-as-regex
key.summary: Whether to match using regular expressions
key.description: If true, the search will be done treating the search text as a regular expression.

key.name: search-default-wrap-around
key.summary: Whether searches wrap the terminal buffer
key.description: If true, a search will move to the bottom of the terminal buffer when it reaches the top item and vice versa.

key.name: encodings
key.summary: List of available encodings
key.description: A subset of possible encodings are presented in the Encoding submenu. This is a list of encodings to appear there.

key.name: warn-vte-config-issue
key.summary: Whether to warn if the VTE configuration issue is detected
key.description: If true, a dialog will be displayed warning the user that VTE is not configured correctly.

key.name: focus-follow-mouse
key.summary: Whether the focus follows the mouse
key.description: If true, a terminal will automatically be focused when the mouse moves over it.

key.name: background-image
key.summary: Path of the background image
key.description: The path of the image to use for the background, requires transparency support.

key.name: background-image-mode
key.summary: The mode to use when rendering the background image
key.description: Whether the background image is rendered scaled, tiled or centered in Tilix.

key.name: background-image-scale
key.summary: The algorithm to use when scaling the background image
key.description: The cairo filter algorithm used to scale the background image, performance will deteroriate with higher quality.

key.name: password-include-return
key.summary: Whether to include return character with password
key.description: If true, when selecting a password to submit to the terminal a return character will automatically be added.

key.name: bookmark-include-return
key.summary: Whether to include return character with bookmark
key.description: If true, when selecting a bookmark to submit to the terminal a return character will automatically be added.

key.name: sidebar-on-right
key.summary: Whether the sidebar should be on the right
key.description: If true, the sidebar will be attached to the right side of the window rather than the left.

key.name: quake-height-percent
key.summary: The height of the terminal as a percent of the screen height
key.description: When in quake mode, the height of the terminal as a percentage of the screen height.

key.name: quake-width-percent
key.summary: The width of the terminal as a percent of the screen width
key.description: When in quake mode, the width of the terminal as a percentage of the screen width.

key.name: quake-active-monitor
key.summary: Display the terminal on the active monitor
key.description: When in quake mode, always display the terminal on the active monitor.

key.name: quake-specific-monitor
key.summary: Display the terminal on a specific monitor if available
key.description: When in quake mode, display the terminal on the specified monitor.

key.name: quake-show-on-all-workspaces
key.summary: Display the terminal on all workspaces
key.description: When in quake mode, display the terminal on all workspaces.

key.name: quake-hide-lose-focus
key.summary: Hide the quake window when focus is lost
key.description: When true, the quake window will be hidden automatically when focus is lost.

key.name: quake-hide-lose-focus-delay
key.summary: Delay used to hide the quake window when focus is lost
key.description: Delay used to hide the quake window so that quick changes in focus do not hide the window.

key.name: quake-alignment
key.summary: The alignment of the quake window
key.description: The alignment of the quake window when the width is less then 100%.

key.name: quake-hide-headerbar
key.summary: Hide the headerbar when running in quake mode
key.description: When true, the headerbar of the quake window will be hidden.

key.name: quake-tab-position
key.summary: The position where the tabs are displayed in Quake mode
key.description: Determines where the tabs are displayed relative to the notebook in quake mode.

key.name: quake-keep-on-top
key.summary: When true the quake window is always kept on top
key.description: When true, the quake window will be kept on top of all other windows.

key.name: quake-window-position
key.summary: The position where the window is displayed in Quake mode
key.description: Determines where the window is displayed relative to the screen in quake mode.

key.name: advanced-paste-replace-tabs
key.summary: Replace tabs with spaces
key.description: If true, replaces tabs with spaces in advanced paste.

key.name: advanced-paste-space-count
key.summary: The number of spaces to use when replacing tabs
key.description: When using advanced paste, the number of spaces to use when replacing tabs.

key.name: advanced-paste-replace-crlf
key.summary: Replace CRLF with LF
key.description: If true, replaces CRLF sequences with LF in advanced paste.

key.name: recent-session-files
key.summary: List of recent session files used
key.description: A list of recently used session files, used for quick loading.

key.name: set-proxy-env
key.summary: Set proxy environment variables
key.description: If true, sets the proxy environment variables if configured in Gnome.

key.name: control-click-titlebar
key.summary: Whether to require control modifier to edit title on click
key.description: If true, editing the title requires using the control key modifier when clicking.

key.name: process-monitor
key.summary: Whether to to enable the process monitor
key.description: If true, the process monitor will be enabled and the option to add the process name to the title will be available.

key.name: custom-hyperlinks
key.summary: A list of custom links that can be clicked on in the terminal
key.description: A list of custom links, each link consists of a regex and optional launcher encoded according to CSV rules.

key.name: triggers

key.description: A list of trigger definitions with each definition consisting of a regex, action to trigger and parameter.

key.name: triggers-lines
key.summary: The maximum number of lines to check for trigger matches
key.description: When the terminal reports a block of text, this setting determines how many lines are checked for trigger matches starting with the last line.

key.name: trigger-unlimit-lines
key.summary: Whether an unlimited number of lines should be processed for triggers
key.description: If true, all available lines will be processed for triggers. When outputing large amounts of text to the terminal this may impact performance.

key.name: use-tabs
key.summary: When true tabs are shown instead of the sidebar
key.description: If true, notebook tabs are used instead of the sidebar as the UI metaphor for sessions.

key.name: tab-position
key.summary: The position where the tabs are displayed
key.description: Determines where the tabs are displayed relative to the notebook.

key.summary: Human-readable name of the profile

key.description: Number of columns in newly created terminal windows. Has no effect if use_custom_default_size is not enabled.

key.name: default-size-rows
key.summary: Default number of rows
key.description: Number of rows in newly created terminal windows. Has no effect if use_custom_default_size is not enabled.

key.name: cell-height-scale
key.summary: Scale factor for the cell height to increase line spacing. (Does not increase the font’s height.)

key.name: cell-width-scale
key.summary: Scale factor for the cell width to increase letter spacing. (Does not increase the font’s width.)

key.name: cursor-blink-mode
key.summary: Whether to blink the cursor

key.name: cursor-shape
key.summary: The cursor appearance

key.summary: Whether to enable blinking text

key.name: terminal-bell

key.description: Determines whether to do nothing, play a sound, show an icon or do both when a bell signal is emitted.

key.name: allow-bold

key.description: If true, allow applications in the terminal to make text boldface.

key.name: bold-is-bright

key.summary: Whether an unlimited number of lines should be kept in scrollback
